intro: Kyllinga hymenopoda, commonly known as the pink sandmat, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, commonly known as the sedge family. The plant has slender, grass-like stems and produces small, pinkish to reddish flowers in dense spikes. Its leaves are typically narrow and cylindrical, with a smooth surface. Kyllinga hymenopoda thrives in wet, sandy soils and is often found in coastal areas or disturbed sites.
